div.span:
COVID-19 Resources: Help For Louisiana Families
As Louisiana works to flatten the curve of the COVID-19 epidemic, please be aware that many resources are available to assist families and individuals who have been affected by the virus. We are reaching out to share information with you about some of these resources and support programs so those who need help, can get help.
Let Us Know If There Are Local Resources Available In Your Community.
As the COVID-19 epidemic continues, we also want to help you get the word out about any local resources that may be available in your area. Please send information about local support programs and resources to Chelsea Graves, Community Relations Principal, at Chelsea.T.Graves@LouisianaHealthConnect.com. Together, we can connect families in need to the right resources in the right places.
These Statewide Resources Are For Everyone.
Apply for Medicaid:
Apply online at www.MyMedicaid.la.gov
Apply by phone at 1-888-342-6207
Print and mail a completed application to Louisiana Medicaid, P.O. Box 91283, Baton Rouge, LA 70821
Apply for SNAP:
Apply online through the CAFÉ customer portal
Text GETSNAP (no spaces) to 898-211
Print and mail a completed application to DCFS Economic Stability, P.O. Box 260031, Baton Rouge, LA 70826
Apply for Unemployment Benefits:
File a claim at www.LouisianaWorks.net/hire
Call the Claim Center at 1-866-783-5567, Monday – Friday, 8 a.m. – 7 p.m.
Note: Please be sure to answer “Yes” when asked, “Are you filing for Unemployment Insurance Benefits for reasons related to COVID-19 (Coronavirus?”
COVID-19 Stimulus Check:
IRS "Get My Payment" Portal
Non-Filers Information Submission Portal (to receive payment if no taxes were filed in 2018 or 2019)
Ecomonic Impact Payment Information
Family Independence Temporary Assistance (FITAP):
Print and mail a completed application to DCFS Economic Stability, P.O. Box 260031, Baton Rouge, LA 70826
Apply online through the CAFÉ Self-Service Portal
Food Assistance:
Women, Infants & Children (WIC) Program: Supplemental nutrition program for pregnant, breastfeeding and postpartum women, infants and children under the age of five
Call 1-800-251-BABY for application information.
Click here to find free school meal sites in your parish.
Self-referral forms for regional food banks:
Central Louisiana
Northeast Louisiana
Northwest Louisiana
Greater Baton Rouge
New Orleans
Acadiana
Meals on Wheels America: Provides nutritious meals to seniors
The Little Free Pantry: A searchable database of neighborhood food pantries across the state
Free Counseling Services:
Call the Keep Calm Through COVID-19 crisis phone line at 1-866-310-7977 any time, 24/7. All calls are confidential.
General Community Resources:
Louisiana Healthcare Connections Community Resources Directory: Free, online directory of community services such as utility assistance, emergency shelter, counseling, food assistance and other programs. Search for needed services by city or zip code to find local programs.
Other Important Resources:
Coronavirus COVID-19 Guidance & Resources: Online directory of COVID-19 information, guidance and recommendations from the Louisiana Department of Health.
Louisiana Believes: Online directory of educational resources for parents and students from the Louisiana Department of Education.
COVID-19 Information & Updates:
Call 211
Text LACOVID to 898-211
Visit www.LA211help.org
We Also Have Resources For Our Members.
Our call center is operating at full capacity. If you are aware of any Louisiana Healthcare Connections members who need assistance, please ask them to call Member Services at 1-866-595-8133, Monday – Friday, 7 a.m. – 7 p.m.
Our 24/7 phone lines are also fully operational:
Nurse Advice: 1-866-595-8133 (ask to speak to a nurse)
Mental Health & Substance Use Crisis: 1-844-677-7553
Our members also have access to free transportation to and from medical appointments, including behavioral health appointments. To schedule a free ride to a medical appointment, our members may call 1-855-369-3723 (Hearing loss: 711) or visit www.myLAride.net, at least 48 hours before their scheduled appointment. Rides to urgent care may be scheduled at any time, 24/7. To learn more about our transportation services, click here.
Thank You For All You Do For Our State.
If we can be of assistance to you during this epidemic, please don't hesitate to reach out to us. We appreciate all you're doing for our members and the communities where they live and work.
Thank you for sharing our commitment to
transforming health in Louisiana, one person at a time.
